Reviews.Title: “Clean, close to Mustafa 24-hour shopping”
Reviews.Author: Nazda
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 2 nights. I noticed that the room was rather small but for a 2-night stay and for 2 persons it was manageable. No wardrobe. Sink is very small. No shampoo was provided, soaps were small and smelled nothing. Kettle is provided but no iron is supplied. No slippers. Bed was ok, pillows were nice. Only one lift/elevator. No extra key was provided during our stay so had to leave the key at the reception every time we went out. Some guests came back very late and we could hear them talking on the corridor, loudly. But overall, rooms was clean and staffs were polite. The hotel is also within walking distance to Mustafa and Farrer Park MRT station (my colleague said MRT Lavender stop was further than the hotel compared to Farrer Park). Taxis are not familiar with this hotel even after I've mentioned that the hotel used to be known as Cityhub Hotel. You may need to mention Jalan Besar...near Kitchener Road... near Mustafa only then some of them got the idea of the location. The receptionists were efficient. Got them to call for cab whenever we need one. Taxi drivers in Singapore were very good.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Vdawar
Reviews.Content: If you are a couple then it is not very good place to stay. Personally we didnt stay there but while on the trip we went to the Hotel as some of our Friend Couples were staying in the Hotel. Little India area is very crowded place specially with people of asian origin. If you have good budget then try Hotels on Orchid Road.

Reviews.Title: “OK”
Reviews.Author: YiliKR
Reviews.Content: We stayed 1 night at the Cultural Hotel (previously known as Citihub) and it was okay for an overnight stay. Paid S$140 which is overpriced for what you get, but Singapore is expensive and I found there is a huge difference in the 2 star hotel chains where you pay half the price and the 3+ star hotels so this hotel was okay. Pros: Clean room, comfortable bed, okay location near little India and Mustafa shopping mall. Cons: Poor service at reception which was looked like a combination of being understaffed (2 people during peak check out morning and had a wait a long time) and reception staff not wanting to be attentive. 10 minute walk to closest MRT (Lavender) and the breakfast was terrible (not worth paying extra for breakfast - go out and enjoy better food). It appears to be a busy hotel with lots of groups. Overall - ok for an overnight stay but better elsewhere (check out Hotel V not far away).

Reviews.Title: “City Hub Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Praveen M
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in Citihub Singapore last October when i went with my family, The room is really clean and the location is really good. You have lots of restaurants at little india. But the complimentary break fast is poor. Despite all Indian customers, they provide more chinese stuff..Also the quality of food is not that great. The staff is arrogant and really irritating . The rooms are small buy neatly arranged, Dont expect anything other than this

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money at all, shop around for something bigger and better”
Reviews.Author: Netty2010
Reviews.Content: Singapore is an expensive place but seriously...this hotel is sooo over priced for the shoe box that you get. Rooms are super small with no view or character at all. The WIFI never worked and the staff kept saying they would get someone to fix it but never did. The baby cot they provided was just a wooden gate surrounding a mattress on the floor - very dangerous because our baby could fit his arm under the bottom of the barrier gate. We had to ask everyday for a 3rd towel (we had 2 adults and 1 baby staying in the room) and yet everyday they would only give us 2 towels! The fridge in the room had no facility to make ice and you can't get it from the hotel restaurant either. The breakfast is terrible and not worth staying for, bad coffee and items such as wedges and onion rings for breakfast! We often asked at reception about how to get somewhere and they would always say 'take a taxi' but this is the most expensive way around and there was always a metro/bus alternative but they knew nothing about these ways of travel.

Reviews.Title: “Unfriendly staff and small rooms”
Reviews.Author: Selina23
Reviews.Content: The staffs are very unfriendly and rude. The rooms were very small and leaking. Not advisable for family with children. The breakfast was terrible.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Lovesgoodfood01
Reviews.Content: We found the reception staff to be very helpful and courteous. They moved rooms around initially so we could check in early (10.30am) and seemed very helpful. The bed, pillows and linen were SO comfortable we had the best nights (5) sleep we could've hoped for. Breakfast was a mix between Asian and Indian food which for us was a treat. Good location with a bus at the front door that goes directly to the Singapore Art Museum and MRT a small block away. Will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Far from everything. bad service . nice rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Andre P
Reviews.Content: The hotel is far from everything. so fou must tåke the metro. 10 min walk. the staff is very rude. F.eks ifølge ask them to order s taxi. they tell you to walk in the street ånd wave. eventogh web hadde 4 suitcases. the rooms are nice.

Reviews.Title: “worst hotel we stayed ever”
Reviews.Author: IssarS
Reviews.Content: stayed only 01 night but it was bad dream for us, we carry our luggages to room upon check-in, because nobody was there. they give only 1 door key, nobody can go out if your partner is sleeping. you have to go other building for breakfast. location is isolated.

Reviews.Title: “go here only if you are on a budget”
Reviews.Author: Zeeshan S
Reviews.Content: Convenient located hotel but should be selected only if on a very tight budget. Walking distance from little India / Mustafa shopping centre and if u walk 10 mins u will reach sim lim square. Very small rooms with no place to move around. NO cupboard also in the hotel. The electronic safe is kept on the ground in a corner of the room. There is only 1 lift in the hotel and the lobby is also very small with only a couple of chairs. The lobby has only 1 bathroom which is common for gents and ladies. Breakfast restraunt is very small and not much variety on the buffet as well . the best thing i felt was the beds, they were were comfortable i must say and very soft too. also the reception will give you only 1 key card even if it is a twin room and you sign an uyndertaking to pay them if you lose the card, open the window, damage the kettle etc. if u have 2 people living and 2 suitcases then u will have to jump over the bags to get across. also one of the mornigns which was my free day meant i could sleep till late but i was woken up by housekeeping at 8 am.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth trying......STAY AWAY”
Reviews.Author: arattansey
Reviews.Content: This is not a hotel in any sense you want to try. We were sold this as a 3-star hotel, but it is really just like a guest house in many ways. I am sure it generates lots of profits for its owners and it may be a reasonably priced option with overall Singapore hotels context, but it is not a good hotel in any manner. The rooms are so small. The equipment is quite aged. Breakfast service is about adequate. There is no lounge area or internet to speak of. They do not offer any real service of any kind. The hotel and its staff are so silly that they make you sign an undertaking to repay them Sin$ 200 for spoiling the hotel - provided kettle. There is also some penalty for opening the windows - so please be careful with that. I would never recommend the hotel or go there again. AR

Reviews.Title: “Not the best of hotels to stay at”
Reviews.Author: VinithM
Reviews.Content: I arrived here at 6 AM on a Saturday. Actual check-in time is 1500 hrs (ow!), so requested for an early check-in. We got the room at 1530 hrs. Time wasted! The rooms are quite compact and not very appealing. The AC did not work and room was quite warm (was sweating). When called to repair the AC I was told to open the windows if the AC did not work (what!!). However, we hardly stayed at the hotel during the day time and only slept for 3-4 hrs max hence did not mind the quality. But i recommend not to stay at this one. There are better hotels available at the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: ThilakrajChennai
Reviews.Content: I took a south indian group and stayed at this hotel for 3nights and 4days.It was pretty decent hotel with all amenities.Staffs were courteous and very helpful.Size of the room is o.k. for 2 people to stay .Bath room is neat and hot water was available through out the day.Indian restaurant is attached to the hotel and serves good indian breakfast.Hotel is walkable distance from Little India area and Mustafa centre( most coveted place for indians).Only draw back is ,this hotel doesn't have a parking space.So,we have to board bus in the next street.This hotel also has bus station at this entrance and MRTS(farer park) at 3minutes walk. Overall ,I will recommend this hotel for stay for all possible reasons.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay for tourists”
Reviews.Author: winviji
Reviews.Content: I found this place quite Okay. The room was clean and well maintained with a medium sized TV, clean bathroom with a powerful shower and hot water. Though small, I found it appropriate for tourists like us who spend most of the day out and spend very less time in the hotel. We could check in early the day we arrived ( around 10 AM). The location is good, with a bus stop just outside the hotel entrance and lots of restaurants nearby. Breakfast could be better though. Overall had a good experience

Reviews.Title: “Don't ever stay here...no services”
Reviews.Author: Mikeyflee
Reviews.Content: When you check in to the Hotel, no one attend to you. Very unfriendly staff....Poor breakfast. Lack of choice and hygiene. Will not come back. Stay on July with friend

Reviews.Title: “If you want to enjoy your holiday - Dont stay here”
Reviews.Author: Vivek80Mumbai
Reviews.Content: Just came back from Singapore couple of days back staying in this hotel for 4 days.. What to say!! & so much to say!! never ever stay here if you want to enjoy your holiday. Some of the experiences which I went through - 1. When I checked in with 5 bags with my wife & 2 yrd old kid and asked them to send the bags to my room they say " Sir, you will have to carry your bags yourself to the room" - Can you believe this.. 2. For a family they gave us a room of 2 individual beds & when I said that I have a infant & we cant sleep in individual beds they said " We cant help you till tom" 3. Managed to join the beds & when asked for a extra blanket they said " Sorry Sir we dont have an extra blanket" 4. For watching TV you will have to put yours ears to the speaker else you cant listen lying in your bed, when I requested the manager to help me increase the volume the response was " Sorry sir we cant increase the volume - anyway the maintenance guy is not there now"... I can go on writing as many instances as I want but request you all please dont ever land up here to spoil your holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Try to stay in some other hotel”
Reviews.Author: TGMdelhi
Reviews.Content: Service during checkin was something like an admission into a jail!!They told us about many penalties about smoking,keeping kettle clean etc.They threatened us that we would be fined heavily if we smoke inside the hotel premises(durijng the night and early morning i had discovered that the hotel staff themselves are smoking heavily within the hotel premises!!)Why this double standards???The room provided was so small that i was practising high jump and long jump in the room during our stay to avoid the obstacles in the room like bed,table etc. The beds were provided separately,You do not have any storage space for keeping your briefcase,suitcase,shaving kit etc.The bathroom was also very small and the toilet was provided with inadequate cleaning facilities. The only plus points are----------proximity to Little India ,Mustafa Mall,indian restaurants etc and that is all.Otherwise,this hotel is not worth staying.IOne more consolation is the adjacent Thangam Palace which serves very good quality of food ,rich in taste. If you can find another hotel in a good location with sufficient space in the room and good staff ,then go for that..........

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel! It felt like our own little apartment! We'll definitely be back.”
Reviews.Author: fromthetreetops
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights and loved this hotel. The room was not too small (though not spacious either), with cupboards and hanging space for clothes, a medium-sized flat screen TV and a comfy queen-sized bed. We were amazed by the facilities provided in the room, which included a mini fridge, hot plate with ventilation hood, microwave, saucepans, plates and cutlery, as well as the usual tea and coffee making equipment. There was even a washing machine in the bathroom, so we could arrive home without the usual pile of dirty clothes from our holiday. It felt like we had our own little apartment! The bathroom was small-ish but perfectly serviceable, with a powerful hot shower, toilet and washbasin, all nicely designed and very clean. The bedding and towels were also spotless, and we were given bottles of water every day. Our room was at the back of the hotel on the fourth floor and we had an interesting view of the nearby apartments and up the road to the sports stadium and swimming complex. The breakfast buffet was delicious: a mixture of foods with something for everyone. There was Indian food such as dosa with sambar and chutney, Malay such as fried rice or noodles, Western such as chicken nuggets, eggs, sausages, and always toast and jam. There was variation in the menu every day. We particularly enjoyed trying the foods that were new to us. Service at reception was polite and efficient, and despite arriving at around 1pm we were allowed to check in early. I had booked our room via Agoda and the check-in and check-out processes were fast and straightforward. Although the hotel website has been re-branded as Cultural Hotel (previously CityHub) the actual hotel still features the old name. We walked to the hotel from Lavender MRT, unintentionally went a long way round and actually walked past it the first time. If you are coming from Lavender, I recommend you walk along Horne Road and then turn left on to Jalan Besar. The hotel is a little way down the road on the left, about 10-15 minutes walk from Lavender MRT. There is also a bus stop right outside the hotel, which serves many buses. Little India is a short walk away. Just north and across the road from the hotel is a 24 hour supermarket, and in the streets around the hotel are many small shops. Walking north from the hotel and turning right are several food courts. We ate at one of these and very much enjoyed our meal. Overall, this was one of our best ever hotel experiences, and we hope to stay there again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing to write home about”
Reviews.Author: Biology-Teacher308
Reviews.Content: We had a stopover in Singapore on our way to Indonesia. We had been traveling for over 30 hours at that point and just really needed the 5 hours of sleep that we were going to get before we had to leave again. Check in was slow. I booked this because it was supposed to be closer to the airport than some of the hotels. Not really. We should have just paid the money and booked the hotel at the airport. I also booked this because they offered breakfast in the price. However, what I didn't take into account when breakfast would be served. We had to leave an hour before they even started to serve breakfast! We had reserved a room with a queen sized bed. We got a room with 2 twin beds. The room was really pretty dirty, but I didn't have the energy to complain. They did have a small refrigerator and a tea maker. The A/C was cold and the shower was fine. I would not have stayed there longer than the 6 hours we were there. I know that there has to be better options.

Reviews.Title: “South Indian Hub Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ster07
Reviews.Content: This hotel was below average. Nothing was thant amazing. The only really good thing was sleeping. The rooms were partially dirty, and we found bugs in our room. The hotel itself is a complete Indian hotel. Almost every last person was indian. And not just any indians...South Inidans. The hotel's bathroom was nice, but there was no hot water making it rather painfull to take a shower. They did have a clean bathroom with complementary tooth brushes. The breakfast was rather disappointing. Most of the food was all south indian food. And for those who know south indian food....its bad. The only thing i could eat was some cold chowmin, eggs, orange juice, and some bread :(. We later transfered to the V hotel which was by far much better and reasonably priced. The staff was nice although a little annoying about how many people we had. Overall this is a below average hotel. Nice but needs a good amount of improvments.

Reviews.Title: “NOT A BAD OPTION !!!”
Reviews.Author: Bhushan_11
Reviews.Content: I Stayed in This hotel during one of my recent visit to Singapore.Best Thing I liked bout the hotel is ITS LOCATION. Its very near to Mustufa Mall the major attraction for shopping in Singapore.Its a clean and neat option with NO SMOKING. I dint expected much from hotels in Singapore as my budget was more on Shopping then for Hotel but evntually I got a nice option.... which i prefer everytime for all the travellers who dont want to spend much on leisure.Attached Wash and clean atmosphere............NOOTHING LESS........NOOTHING MOREEEEEE....

Reviews.Title: “Stay only if on a shoestring budget”
Reviews.Author: SteveMumbai
Reviews.Content: Very big hotel, just one elevator, long wait to go up to our rooms. No control over the children who keep running on the corridor at night, but once we complained the manager took over and ensured that we had a peaceful night. That was very commendable. Restaurant - Thangams - very good dinner, but expect at least eggs to order at breakfast. Staff especially the manager, very helpful

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location!”
Reviews.Author: Preety2389
Reviews.Content: City Hub hotel in Singapore is a very nice hotel to stay. Easy access to the Airport, good surrounding, all the amenities around and so on. Neayby malls, restaurants and everything one needs to have.

Reviews.Title: “Easy way to access anywhere in the city”
Reviews.Author: JK1425DAS
Reviews.Content: Cityhub Hotel is accessible via airport shuttle, bus and MRT. The bus stops directly in front of the hotel, and the two MRT stations (Lavender and Farrer Park, They expect visitors to use teh same soap dispensor for toilet as well as for bath. What about Hygiene??? Will never recommend to friends. Will never stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely Poor facilities”
Reviews.Author: RTewari
Reviews.Content: The hotel rooms are small. The toilets are not very clean. Funny...but true.....Have only ONE SOAP DISPENSOR in the Bathroom. They expect visitors to use teh same soap dispensor for toilet as well as for bath. What about Hygiene??? Will never recommend to friends. Will never stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Room booking not honoured at Cityhub Hotel Singapore”
Reviews.Author: dlr01
Reviews.Content: I booked Cityhub Hotel in June 2010 for our family holiday in December in Singapore, via an internet hotel booking website. I received email confirmation of this booking. We, my husband , myself and two children arived in Singapore at 12.35 am on the 30th December and the hotel refused to honour the booking. They said there had never been a booking made and they had never heard of us, even though we had the email with us confirming our booking. We were treated very poorly and I would not recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “uncomfortable and shabby for the price”
Reviews.Author: teecup
Reviews.Content: Cityhub Hotel is one of the “budget” hotels recommended by travel agencies. We stayed here for 4 days and here's our honest rundown of the hotel's good, bad and ugly points: LOCATION. Cityhub Hotel is accessible via airport shuttle, bus and MRT. The bus stops directly in front of the hotel, and the two MRT stations (Lavender and Farrer Park) are each a good 10 to 15-minute walk. Many travel agencies and tour operators have tie-ups with this hotel, making tour pick-ups and transfers convenient. Jalan Besar Plaza, Mustafa Centre and City Square Mall (which connects directly to Farrer Park MRT) surround Cityhub. There are old houses, eateries and small shops all over. The neighborhood is a fine place to find an array of merchandise. For high-end wares, we recommend that you visit the Orchard or take Bus 857 that leads directly to Suntec Mall. SERVICE. Guests who expect to see Singapore’s fabled reputation for cleanliness and great tourism are in for a major disappointment. We were appalled by the lack of hygiene and customer service in this hotel. The hotel lobby was almost non-existent as it was always cramped with luggage. It also reeked of body odor. Perhaps the deal breaker for us was the staff’s “hospitality” which bordered towards hostility. Hotel personnel should get a crash course on basic courtesy and respect if they expect to stay in business. There were no thank you’s, no smiles and no attempts to even open doors for us from the staff. Instead of being welcomed, we were warned by the front desk of the penalties meted for lost items, misused facilities and sundry. There were a few occasions when we witnessed the staff arguing with the guests and ordering them around! The personnel from the restaurant even cleared away our plates and cups when we weren’t even done yet with breakfast. ROOM. We were billeted in a standard room in the fourth floor. There was only one lift servicing all seven floors but it was impressively fast. The size of our room was nothing to rant about. It was small and the outside view was not the loveliest. What really bothered us was the lack of sanitation. The carpet was dirty, the shower stained and the tea cups unwashed. We could not muster to use the towels for they smelled too. The room and the facilities were shamefully shabby for the rates. In fairness, basic items were provided such as toothbrushes, toothpaste, soap and shampoo. Our standard room also had a bachelor’s refrigerator, an electric kettle, a hair dryer and a safe (which we did not try using). In addition, the wired internet connection was complimentary (but make sure you ask for the internet cable, else the staff won’t even hint that it’s available). Water pressure was good. The air conditioner was quiet. The TV deserves a pass – not unless you’re a fan of 1990s HBO movie re-runs. In our experience, the hotel provided little value for the nightly rate of 280 SG dollars! Even though the cost gets cut down to half when booking through online sites, the quality of our stay, the level of cleanliness and the kind of customer service (or disservice) we experienced were quite disappointing. We have no intentions of returning to this hotel or recommending it to friends. Note: The hotel strictly observes a check-in time of 3:00 p.m. and a check-out time of 12:00 noon. Early check-in is almost impossible as there are hordes of tour groups that get accommodated daily. For guests who are into budget accommodations and passable customer care, there are hostels directly across Cityhub that you may want to try out: Fernloft, Welcome Inn and Citilights.

Reviews.Title: “Average stay”
Reviews.Author: 2010New
Reviews.Content: City Hub is near to shopping malls; most noticeable shopping mall - walking distance from the hotel is Mustafa (24 hour shopping mall). Hotel room size is bit smaller compared to other hotels with good cleanliness; some of the points that I noted and will be helpful - A little away from major tourist destinations (anyway Singapore itself is small city). - Near to eating joints, malls and small shopping areas - Food is primarily Indian; good food at good price - Reception is small with limited seating capacity - Lot of improvement at reception desk is required when someone calls you from your home country and does not know the room number; it was a bit odd and annoying that they do not check the system and connect the phone. - on whole average hotel with 2-3 days limited option to stay; if you are planning to stay for more than 3 days; suggest try some other hotel

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel....one of the better ones in mid-range category”
Reviews.Author: gautammasand
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights for attending ITB Asia.. Payed bit more than expected but the hotel this time,diud seem crowded with some Tourist Groups from India, then followed by Sri Lanka This time again,I was lucky toget an early check-in as my flight again landed by 8 am and reached the hotel by 9. Had breakfast in the restaurant adjoining and wereallowed to check in at around 10 am This was kind asstandard check-in time is 1500, and the hotel did seem crowded...loads of bags in the lobby. The rooms were reasonably sized for 2.they also had free Internet, which u need to collect the cable from the lobby. Remember this is a smoke-free hotel and u will be fined sgd 200 if u smoke in hotel premises....just fyi One funny thing was that we were provided only 1 crad...whereas we were 2 (my boss and I) The staff claimed that they had a shortage of crads.....so each night when my boss would go to sleep and I would step out for a walk or coffee, I would needto request the staff to come up and swipe open the door for me....did this for 3 nights. breakfast was decent.........fries, chicken sausages,eggs, fried rice (??), jam/butter bread, couple of variety of juices and idli or uthapam with smabar and coconut chutney/sauce.....filling,hot and some new stuff each day Flat screen decent TV set-clear but had only around 10 channels....... The location was decent........not far from Mustafa and other Indian estaurants and Farrer Park MRT. All in all it was decent.....no complaints!!

Reviews.Title: “comfortable...no frills hotel”
Reviews.Author: vivek g
Reviews.Content: positive points - location, hygiene, tea coffer maker, hair dryer, near to little india and Mustafa. negative points - no frills bathroom - no bath soap/ shampoo, no jet pump, no newspaper in room, free water bottle only once during check in. must do at singapore - visit mustafa, sentosa, night safari, singapore flyer, Clarke Quay (night life). buy LCD TV... from Mustafa or Niranjan. very cheap in comparison to India.

Reviews.Title: “bad value for money - no respect for indians”
Reviews.Author: indianMumbai
Reviews.Content: the staff is very rude and makes country specific remarks... although the majority of the hotel is run on indian touritsts... there are no bells boys to take your luggage to and from the room the room is over before it starts bed is ok for 3 only if a small kid is there. location is good. breakfast is ok... it could be skipped... nothing to miss...

Reviews.Title: “tHe cOzzzY bEDs of sIngApOooRe....”
Reviews.Author: BratyBoy
Reviews.Content: Date:2 July 2010 We booked this Hotel after checking them online through an agent. The cozzy beds of CITYHUB, Singapore was the best as i had a bash in the day and full rest in the night. Zero noise Zero knockknocks Zero calls it was sleeping heaven with not so bad view and facilities. The travel time between my destination was also very less as the CITYHUB is placed perfectly. The room service could have been better though. Neat and clean toilets,rooms,corridors and Lobby. Food at the restaurant was good. But the local delicacies should have been promoted more. It was pretty relaxing place.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms”
Reviews.Author: abeePune
Reviews.Content: Staff in hotel is not friendly, very rude like military camp, room/bath room size r too small & very costly

Reviews.Title: “Value for your money”
Reviews.Author: braoj
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 days at Cityhub while in Singapore this May. Experience was good. One of the few hotels that would accomodate 2 adults and 2 kids (13, 10 yrs) in one room. Room was clean but space was a little tight... since we spent most of the time outdoors it didn't matter. Staff were friendly and helpful. Is located walking distance to Mustafa Center Money Changer and Citysquare mall. Breakfast buffet provided in the Indian reataruant next door ...choice not that great...but u can still fill ur tummy if u enjoy Indian food. Good chinese vegetarian restaurant (New Fut Kai) next door. Kids preferred the Subway at the mall close by. We went on a guided tour to Sentosa Island and Night Safar arranged by the front desk. On the whole had a good stay at Cityhub and Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “not very clean and basic service”
Reviews.Author: lost_gaucho
Reviews.Content: We stayed there with our three small kids. When we arrived from Thailand, after lunch time, we couldn't check in, so were told to go somewhere while they prepare a room. Fair enough. The room was spacious and so was the bathroom. We liked to have free internet, which at this day and age, surprisingly isn't offered more frequently at hotels worldwide. The hotel is very, very basic on what if offers. For breakfast, we walked next door to this restaurant that served mostly Indian style breakfast. Granted, this hotel is in Little India, but this is still Singapore. If you weren't so adventurous to try (and our small kids mostly weren't) you would end up with only bread and jam, since there was no fruit or anything else to suit other palates. What we didn't like was the cleaning service, the worst we encountered in the 4 months we were traveling through the area.The bathroom I think was never cleaned and sometimes they didn't even clean the room. On the first night, they didn't want to provide linens for our third child sleeping in a playpen, which they had provided themselves following our previous online communication. They somehow suggesting this room was only for 4 people and we brought one extra...Crazy! Next day the other person on that shift was very nice and quickly fixed the situation. After this, we received good service. They arranged a taxi van for us and made some suggestions on what to do in Singapore, although basic ones. After checking out, they locked all our luggage on the lobby for us, so that we could still go out and enjoy the day before our flight. They have chains and locks and it is a common thing they do for their customers. It was the only hotel that could accommodate 5 people in a room that I was able to find online, that is the sole reason that we picked it. We didn't have much choice. However, if we ever go to Singapore again, I would definitely try harder to find another place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive but not worth the money and ambience”
Reviews.Author: laksundar1
Reviews.Content: Date: 05 May 2010 We stayed for 3 days and they gave me a room without even cleaning up the room. We were shocked to see a small room and they called it as a superior room but we have booked for a delux room. They provided us a delux room later which was similar in size but facing the street. This place is only suitable for tour packages. Since we came only in the night for sleeping we didn't notice much on the other features. They were only curious to know if our local relatives who visited us were going to stay with us. Front desk need to be inculcated about hospitality.

Reviews.Title: “Service great, but expensive room that smelled like urine”
Reviews.Author: MSBNorway
Reviews.Content: On our way back from Australia we got stuck in Singapore due to the Volcanic Ash cloud over Europe and had to stay 4 nights in Singapore - our last night at this hotel. Everything was fully booked which meant that hotels could charge whatever for their rooms. We got the last room in this hotel. A large room for 4 people (we were 2). The Service was absolutely great! Since we could not check in before the standard check-in time and needed a shirt ironed, they did it for us free of charge. We also ran a bit late for the checkout so I asked the reception whether it was ok to be 20 minutes late with our checkout - this was ok. However.... the room cost us 288 Singapore dollars (which was the most expensive room we had had so far there and the worst room as well) - so little value for money. The room stank! (however you got used to it). In the entrance area of the room, it smelled like urine (therefore the low rating of the cleanliness and rooms). The room looked clean, the sheets were clean, towels clean etc.... I think this hotel is targeted towards indian travellers as the breakfast was not western - it was indian style (but interesting) - curry and some white patties. - Hygiene wise I'm not sure I would eat there as the staff handled food directly with their hands after lifting other non food items. So bring imodium to reduce the risk of trouble belly afterwards. I would not stay here again.... but having read other travellers reviews, the service was great and we did not experience any grumpy staff etc.

Reviews.Title: “Ok, but cleanliness an issue”
Reviews.Author: JSRP
Reviews.Content: Room generallly okay and service stoic but fine. Nice tv and free bottled water and free internet are all highly welcomed. A bus stop right outside is also great to have, as Singapore's buses are excellent modes of public transport. However, bathroom smelt bad, and mold around sink was off putting. Previous guest had evidently shaved, and hairs around sink, and on hairdryer remained. Shower is a similar story. Toilet apparently uncleaned, and spatters of something around toilet and sink had dried on wall. Carpet in bedroom itself showed evidence of not being cleaned. Towels and bed linen had what we assumed were mild rust stains. Day 1: Requested housekeeping. No improvement. Day 2: Informed staff at reception with great politeness about the state of the bathroom. Received no apology. Was just asked for room number and told housekeeping would see to it. Returned at end of the day to find absolutely no change in bathroom's condition, and carpet un-vacuumed.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: jcn_uk
Reviews.Content: I visit Singapore at least once a year, and often spend my first night there at a "budget" hotel, although "budget" in Singapore often means £60 or more. This time I stayed at the new City Hub hotel for one night, and this was a great last minute choice. The best budget hotel I ever stayed in, beating the Ibis. Granted, I was given the biggest room in the hotel. It is for 4 people (although we were 2), and the bathroom is disabled-ready, which makes it very big. So, all in all, maybe I was just lucky - try and ask for room 901 if you stay there. The room is spotless, with a big LCD TV, and plenty of coffee, tea, and water. The bathroom, as I said, is large, and equipped for 4, so you get 4 towels, 4 sets of toiletry, etc. The hotel offers a buffet breakfast, but, to be honest, unless you enjoy indian food early in the morning, you will be stuck with bread and coffee. In terms of location: it is at the edge of Little India. If you don't know Singapore, this is perhaps not the best place to stay, simply because it is not central enough. But there are buses going every where in Jalan Besar, and the Lavender station is close by. In fact, since Lavender station is in east-west (green) line (the same as the airport), this is a good option for a short stopover. To get to the hotel from the station, do the following: 1. Take exit "B" on Lavender. Facing the street, walk to your left and make another left at Horne Road. 2. Keep walking on Horne Road for about 5 minutes, passing the Jalan Besar stadium. 3. Turn left on Jalan Besar, and the hotel is about 50 meters on your left. All in all, a 10 minutes walk at a slow pace. I personally think that Little India is a great place to star your Singapore exploration. The contrast with Orchard Road is amazing. You feel like you cross the world if you take the 65 bus from the hotel to Orchard station. Besides the shopping and food options in Little India, you find the cheapest Internet cafes, often charging SGD1/hour. I would definitely recomend the CityHub as the best budget option in Singapore. Even if you stay at a fancier hotel (as I do), the CityHub is still a good option for either a late arrival, or a early departure, when it would not make sense to pay the full price of a 4 or 5 stars hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel CityHub in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Vidyagmcs
Reviews.Content: Hi, I have nothing great to say about this Hotel as we had gone with one of our friends advice. Though the Hotel is very much within the City but Service at this Hotel was very Poor. They dont bother about booking the Room based on Online Booking and also had very bad service with the Breakfast as well as Room Quality. I wouldn prefer anyone to stay in this hotel untill and unless you have Money Issues. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Real Value for money - Go grab it Indians”
Reviews.Author: venkygin
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Hotel Cityhub between 2nd Dec and 5th Dec. I booked this hotel purely based on reviews that I read online. I realized that this is a prefect den for Indians and I am one. Pros : 1. Proximity to Syed Alwi road (just 3 mins walk) where you have great Indian food joints like Hotel Raj (the best for vegetarians) , Saravana bhavan , Murugan idly shop , Bombay cafe etc. 2. On Syed Alwi rd , you also have Mustafa - the place for shopping. 3. Little India is again 7 mins walk. You have temples and more restaurants. 4. City hub is centrally located and hence commuting by taxi is very easy. Also you have a bus stop right in front of the hotel. 5. I read in some reviews that the hotel is noicy , but at least I dint hear any noice. Probably because I was on 4th floor. But yes , the reception is always crowded and filled with Indian tourists (the tour operators prefer this hotel) 6. Internet is free and pretty fast. 7. Mineral water provided throughout. 2 bottles a day. No issues with service. Cons: 1. No cupboard/storage to store your clothes. They just provide a small place with hangers to hang your clothes. 2. 2-3 small cockroaches were spotted in the room , but no big trouble. If you are looking for value proposition then this is the place for you. Hassle free.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant , nice Budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: PR1965
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through internet. The rates of the hotel are competitive and includes buffet breakfast. The rooms though not spacious are nice and elegant. The service was excellent and cleanliness impeccable. Though the hotel can improve on the variety of food items at Breakfast the breakfast was delicious and tasty. The hotel staff was slightly stiff, however responsive and caring. A great budget place to stay at.

Reviews.Title: “Lot of room ...............for improvement”
Reviews.Author: Rupesh_Berry
Reviews.Content: I spent 4 days in the hotel with my family -wife and 2 boys aged 6 and 3 yrs. The hotel provided an extra bed in a standard double bed room which made very cramped. The hotel was over packed with a lot of tourists. Lot of noise. The lobby would always be full with some people arriving but not getting rooms since check in time was 1 pm and check out time was 1200 noon .Many persons would check out and wait in the lobby. Also another irritating thing was the housekeeping would come in every morning and knock on all doors at 8 am .So if you are planning to sleep in don’t be there. Cleanliness had a lot of room for improvement. Overall if you are planning to just be out of the hotel and come back in to sleep it was fine but if you are planning to spend anytime in the hotel find another place. A good idea –we did this ---if you arrive early and have to wait for a check in go to the Jalan Besar swimming pool complex nearby….100 m from the hotel…. The free internet was a definite plus

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: TerryEmu
Reviews.Content: We stayed on night in transit from Thailand. We went for breakfast where a large Indian tour group were just finishing, all that was on offer were cold dhal and chicken nuggets. It could be that Little India is OK to visit but not stay in.

HotelInfo.Name: Cultural Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 270 Jalan Besar 01-01/02 | Little India, Singapore 209019, Singapore
